page.title: 02Local History Stradey Castle
page.content: The owner of Stradey Castle is Mr David Mansel Lewis,The Lord Lieutenant of Dyfed.He has been living there all his life.The castle was built between 1850 and 1874.The old castle at the bottom of the garden was built in 1600 and was demolished in 1845.In 1873 a 4m by 3m painting depicting Diogenes and Alexander the Great was painted by William De Riviere who taught Charles William Mansel Lewis the present owner's grandfather.Riviere and the architect Buckner who designed the magnificent staircase,worked together during 1873 and 1874 on these two complementing masterpieces found in the main hall.There are about 24 room in the castle 12 habitable rooms and 12 others.The estate is about 1,500 acres.This includes 300 to 400 acres of woodland much of which has evolved naturally.
